com.github.moribund.screens.game

Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.moribund.screens.game.GameScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class GameScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    The GameScreen is the screen of the main game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera camera
      The camera to show the game on.
      private com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch spriteBatch
      The sprite batch to display sprites.

      • show

        public void show()
        The equivalent of ApplicationListener.create() where this is run as soon as this screen is displayed.
        Specified by:

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        Renders the Screen by clearing the GL and drawing the sprites. Essentially, this is the heart of the game's Sprites.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
        Parameters:
        delta - As of now, unclassified usage.

      • drawVisibleEntities

        private void drawVisibleEntities()
        Draws all the PlayableCharacter's Sprites.

      • processFlags

        private void processFlags()
        Processes all the Flags flagged on the PlayableCharacters of the game.

      • clearGl

        private void clearGl()
        Clears the GL buffer. This program, as proven by imports, uses OpenGL 2.0+.

      • drawSpriteBatch

        private void drawSpriteBatch(java.lang.Runnable drawing)
        Draws the SpriteBatch by enabling it for drawing and taking in the drawing actions of drawing Sprites. It then closes the SpriteBatch.
        Parameters:
        drawing - The Runnable drawing actions (typically using SpriteContainer to draw them) executed just before the SpriteBatch ends.
